{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3397304,"name":"Zachary Newkirk","username":"midnight9385","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/midnight9385/{size}/226311_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-10T18:45:24.344Z","cooked":"

I want to use the Orange Pi for camera vision but was confused about exactly what cameras I could use and whether they needed an additional board to interface with the pi. I was wondering I could can just get a camera like this and be able to plug it directly into the MIPI DSI interface or if I need an additional board like a camera adapter to interface. Any insight would be helpful, thank you.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-10T18:45:24.344Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1325,"reads":332,"readers_count":331,"score":6686.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Zachary Newkirk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.arducam.com/product/arducam-2mp-global-shutter-og02b10-color-camera-modules-pivariety-b0348/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":97}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66479,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3310 Student Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/1","custom_user_title":"3310 Student Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3397330,"name":"Vaughn Khouri","username":"CyberClone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberclone/{size}/229178_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-10T19:37:25.610Z","cooked":"

You’re on the right track, Arducam global shutter cameras are what the majority of teams with custom setups use. Note that there are several models, I think 6328 did a writeup on that at some point? They mostly vary in BW/RBG, frame rate, etc but have the same mourning pattern.

However there’s no need for the ribbon cable as Arducam makes cameras that connect over USB. So you just go straight into the opi and it basically just works.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-10T19:37:25.610Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":318,"readers_count":317,"score":88.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Vaughn Khouri","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52319,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397347,"name":"Zachary Newkirk","username":"midnight9385","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/midnight9385/{size}/226311_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-10T20:02:57.712Z","cooked":"

Thank you, I’ll look at the 6328 write up. In regards to the camera cable because the one I was looking at is a pivariety camera I don’t think it connects with usb, It also comes with an FPC cable; I could be wrong though. Nonetheless thank you.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-10T20:02:57.712Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":287,"readers_count":286,"score":77.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Zachary Newkirk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":52319,"username":"CyberClone","name":"Vaughn Khouri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cyberclone/{size}/229178_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66479,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3310 Student Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/3","custom_user_title":"3310 Student Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397366,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-10T20:23:57.052Z","cooked":"

When we used an OrangePi for Photonvision two years ago, we were never able to find a camera that actually interfaced with the camera ports on the Orange Pi (which are different than what RasberryPis use).

If I recall correctly from the bit of research I did at the time, it seems like it’s not just a pinout/connector difference but that the OrangePi camera ports actually use a different protocol which is fairly uncommon (or at least was when we were looking into it). We ended up just using USB global shutter cameras that year, and have since moved to Limelights due to consistency/accuracy issues we had with Photovision.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-10T20:23:57.052Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":223.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/using-a-raspberry-pi-hdmi-to-csi-module-with-an-orange-pi/471216","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Using a Raspberry Pi HDMI to CSI Module with an Orange Pi","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397377,"name":"Zachary Newkirk","username":"midnight9385","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/midnight9385/{size}/226311_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-10T20:34:40.026Z","cooked":"

Yea I had seen something about OPi using DVP I think instead of MIPI CSI which RPi uses. I found this that talks about converting MIPI to DVP, I wonder if the OPi camera modules they have do this since they have an adapter board. How did the usb camera work performance wise, I might just need to use one.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-10T20:34:40.026Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":257,"readers_count":256,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Zachary Newkirk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://hackaday.io/project/16026-raspberry-pi-camera-on-orange-pi-plus-board#:~:text=The%20Allwinner%20H3%20processor%20on,MIPI%20mode%20instead%20of%20DVP.","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Raspberry Pi camera on Orange Pi Plus board | Hackaday.io","clicks":38}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66479,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3310 Student Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/5","custom_user_title":"3310 Student Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397428,"name":"Chris Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-10T22:44:18.458Z","cooked":"

The USB cameras themselves were fine, especially if you were just using 1 of them, our issues were more on the PhotonVision side of things. We also got a bit ambitious and tried running 2-3 cameras on one Orange Pi (the teams that had the best success with Orange Pis ran 1 to 1, or so I hear) and ran into all kinds of cooling issues to the point where we mounted a pair of 15k RPM 40mm server fans to it to keep it from thermal throttling.

Our hope for using PiCams was that we could decrease some of the overhead you get from a USB interface and improve performance, framerates, and resolution, and reduce latency.

At one point we even played around with the idea of getting a literal laptop motherboard (with dedicated graphics) and connecting the USB cameras that way to eliminate any possible performance bottlenecks, since a regular computer can run USB cameras at max framerates basically without any issues.

Incidentally, if I’m not mistaken, the camera modules on the USB cameras we were using are the same as the ones the new Limelight 3Gs use. We plan on upgrading our regular LL3s to use those camera modules as well at some point too.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-10T22:46:33.991Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":235,"readers_count":234,"score":72.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Chris Bale","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66479,"username":"midnight9385","name":"Zachary Newkirk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/midnight9385/{size}/226311_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6560,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397473,"name":"Zachary Newkirk","username":"midnight9385","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/midnight9385/{size}/226311_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-11T01:14:50.821Z","cooked":"

Cool I’ll look more into them then. I did some more reading and my confusion sprung from the fact that the ports say MIPI but if you google RPi cam on OPi it says it only supports DVP because of the processor. However that processor isn’t used in the OPi5, so I’m assuming any MIPI camera would work since the processor isn’t limiting. If not I can just get a USB Camera Shield or find another camera that is usb. Thank you.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-11T01:14:50.821Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":191,"readers_count":190,"score":53.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Zachary Newkirk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66479,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3310 Student Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/7","custom_user_title":"3310 Student Programmer","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3397953,"name":"Brett B Bonner","username":"bbonner","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bbonner/{size}/155176_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-12T04:32:57.385Z","cooked":"
cbale2000:

We also got a bit ambitious and tried running 2-3 cameras on one Orange Pi (the teams that had the best success with Orange Pis ran 1 to 1, or so I hear)

As described in our build thread, this year we ran two OV2311 USB cameras per OPi5 at 1600x1200 (~2MP) at 20-30FPS (each pipeline). We didn’t do anything special with cooling - the two boards with heat sinks were in a single 3D printed case with ventilation slots, but just convection cooling.

This is with our custom vision system Northstar, which uses gstreamer to handle the decompression of the incoming MJPEG camera stream. That is actually a significant chunk of the processing required.

One advantage of USB is the ease of cabling. Most of the MIPI-CSI cameras have short flex cables that are fragile and hard to extend, so you’d need the processor board in close proximity to the cameras. This can be very difficult to arrange on a densely packed robot.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-12T04:32:57.385Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":158,"readers_count":157,"score":101.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Brett B Bonner","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48574,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/8","custom_user_title":"6328 Mentor - Electrical/Controls","reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3398126,"name":"Matt","username":"thatmattguy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatmattguy/{size}/222358_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-12T17:32:20.511Z","cooked":"

There’s no way to use MIPI cameras easily with the orange pi that I’m aware of. Both because of pinout (the orange pi connector is different from the pi-style FFC connector), and nobody’s put in the Linux kernel side leg work to get V4L working out of the box. I believe 971 had success with a rock pi a couple years ago, but they used a C++ gstreamer driver written in house.

So until someone figured out both those things, you’ll have to use a USB camera.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-12T17:32:38.316Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":68.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Matt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":37738,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"cry","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3398251,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-12T22:06:57.773Z","cooked":"

We ran 3 USB cameras off 1 OPi5 computer, with no problems, two OV9281 for AprilTags and a color for Note detection. The AprilTags ran at about 60Hz. Passive cooling and we did not notice any heat problems.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-06-12T22:06:57.773Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":71.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":467460,"topic_slug":"orange-pi-cameras","display_username":"Paul Rensing","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25118,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 2877 LigerBots Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/orange-pi-cameras/467460/10","custom_user_title":"FRC 2877 LigerBots Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3398256,"name":"Zachary Newkirk","username":"midnight9385","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/midnight9385/{size}/226311_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-12T22:38:50.918Z","cooked":"

It didn’t even occur to me that the connections were, or could be, different. Thanks for that info. I might just look at alternatives to the orange pi, I wasn’t quite settled on it yet. It kind of confusing why they’d choose to use a different kind of connection but oh well. Again thank you.
